item.title: The prevalence of bad matrix models
item.description: My students in 211 have revealed that there are an astonishing number of animal population matrices still being published with fundamental errors, including no survival in the reproductive term, failing to hit first breeding in models with post-breeding censuses, and incorrect maturation fractions in stage-for-age models (basically, if stage duration is T, they say that the maturation fraction is \(1/T\)).
